topic.title: Can a 0netizen host a local torrent index. The code is on github.
topic.body:
If if you got a high-speed connection and a few gigs to spare, please give this lovely thing a whirl, save it on a zeronet site, and tell us the address:

https://github.com/sergiotapia/magnetissimo

it speedily saves torrent indexes offline. like really fast. i'd do it myself, but my isp watches my ass like a hawk.

7186_1KbV1e1u6P6AsY8XNBydgtbtN8iSB5WMyG.body:
Bullocks, if they had access they wouldn't let it leak to the media.

No additional meta data, this is just a ruse to get ISIS to get to shutdown Telegram channels, that are hard to infiltrate.

1_1M4Ab8CUu3byziHVvNXLHmPezC4Lg9hvNJ.body:
Original Post.
https://zero.acelewis.com/

I had a problem when making a blog post about ZeroNet when I wanted to link to a proxy. I was worried that the proxy I link to will go down and I will have to update all of the links when I find out, e.g http://zero.pags.to:43110/, http://zeropro.xyz and https://zeroproxy.atomike.ninja/ all have gone down.

So I decided to make a "meta proxy" basically you can create a link on the site, when someone clicks that link the site will take them to a working proxy so they can browse ZeroNet. The benefit of this is you don't have to update links when/if a proxy goes down. Currently it is only using one proxy http://bit.no.com because that is the only publicly running proxy I know of so running one would be helpful, the website is set up so it will randomly pick a proxy for the user from a list of working proxies I will maintain.

The conversion of links is simple, you just need to replace the "127.0.0.1:43110/" with "zero.acelewis.com#" so: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1HeLLo4uzjaLetFx6NH3PMwFP3qbRbTf3D/ becomes https://zero.acelewis.com/#1HeLLo4uzjaLetFx6NH3PMwFP3qbRbTf3D/

As I am running this on GitHub pages https://github.com/AceLewis/AceZeroProxy the hosting costs are free (so the site will not randomly shut down due to me not paying hosting) and you can contribute to make the site better. I don't like the name that much but could not think of a better one.

Also I don't recommend browsing on proxies whilst logged in they should be used to show people ZeroNet or allow people to view content that was published anonymously and decentralized on ZeroNet (where ZeroNet benefits the publisher and not the viewer).

I would like to thank /u/SummonWho (@gabriicom) who made it look nice by giving me the HTML, CSS and JS for the front end.

https://zero.acelewis.com/

1_17Cs2auSHSVjKaYMXqbNMApRQrgXcwJUpL.body: Great, thus far. It needs alot of work, but, quite polished for such a young product.

1_1KCg4tQ1dBRfMWZ8ptrqXSSUKKR11rYb6P.body: You need to build it from scratch the languages behind KAT need a central server. You can only use JS,HTML,CSS and SQLITE on 0net.

7236_1KbV1e1u6P6AsY8XNBydgtbtN8iSB5WMyG.body:
It should be a crime to reference studies without linking to them or naming them by unique identifiers. I did some digging and  the Rand Study does not even link to the full research paper. http://www.rand.org/pubs/research_briefs/RB9925.html

One of the lead researchers on the project has a full page of his publications here, which are a lot more useful.
http://www.daviddh.com/en/publications/

1_1M3WXb3DtLL9zsRy4ECqemV7ZyA4u4FNFU.body: Yes absolutely, just like if you use a vpn with a torrent properly you can't be uniquely identified easily. 0net is alot safer because you have alot less backend server requests. It's clean and simple.

Also just going to post bitmessage. It is better than 0net for anonymous communication.

It is the best way to communicate and stay anon.

Bitmessage Links
https://bitmessage.org/wiki/Main_Page
https://bitmessage.org/forum/index.php
https://www.reddit.com/r/bitmessage/
